Comment: When I am playing White, I like the Scotch
h5 was unexpected.  Wonder if he has some kind of trap.  Will go ahead and take the pawn

h5 was unexpected.  Wonder if he has some kind of trap.  Will go ahead and take the pawn
Qh4 was also unexpected.  Looks like this will not be a standard Scotch game
Qh4 was also unexpected.  Looks like this will not be a standard Scotch game
Qxf7 would be mate

It blocks the mate but it seems to isolate his Queen.  Two attacks on the e pawn, guarded only once.  Nc3 will defend the e pawn and get a Knight out.  He will probably chased the knight at some point.  If he doesn't chase the Knight, I will either do d4 or Bc4.  Bc4 would give an attack on Black's f pawn.
got to defend the e pawn - attacked twice defended once
don't like have to touch the knight so many times and it is still not in a good place.  cant push the d pawn.
don't like have to touch the knight so many times and it is still not in a good place.  cant push the d pawn.

going to have to move the knight again.  considered Nd5 but settled for Ne2 so I will have some time to do either d4 or d3. With all the stuff Black has on the kingside, I thinking castling Queenside.
